page.title: 18Traditional Diet of Papa.
page.content: Fish,mutton,potatoes,kale (cabbage) and bere meal were the staple foods of the Shetland diet. Now more exotic foods are imported and bere (a sort of multi-grained barley) is not grown much.The tiny water mills that were used to grind it are still dotted about the islands, Papa has more than a dozen. Visitors are often perplexed by the round stone enclosures sprinkled over the island.These are the planti-crubs where crofters sow their kale seed.The plants over-winter in these harsh conditions,ready for planting out in the yards in spring.It is an important fodder crop as well as a valuable source of vitamin C for humans. Fish and mutton have always played an important part in our diet either fresh,or dried and salted.Numerous varieties of potatoes are cultivated.
